definitions.definition: A shelly concretion, usually rounded, and having a brilliant luster , with varying tints , found in the mantle, or between the mantle and shell, of certain bivalve mollusks, especially in the pearl oysters and river mussels, and sometimes in certain univalves. It is usually due to a secretion of shelly substance around some irritating foreign particle. Its substance is the same as nacre , or mother-of-pearl. Round lustrous pearls are used in jewellery.
A capsule of gelatin or similar substance containing liquid for e.g. medicinal application.
A whitish speck or film on the eye.
A fish allied to the turbot ; the brill .
One of the circle of tubercles which form the bur on a deer's antler.
A valuable little nugget of information; especially, an aphorism or tip that is operationally useful for decision-making.
Argent , in blazoning by precious stones.
The size of type between diamond and agate , standardized as 5- point .

main_definition: A shelly concretion, usually rounded, and having a brilliant luster , with varying tints , found in the mantle, or between the mantle and shell, of certain bivalve mollusks, especially in the pearl oysters and river mussels, and sometimes in certain univalves. It is usually due to a secretion of shelly substance around some irritating foreign particle. Its substance is the same as nacre , or mother-of-pearl. Round lustrous pearls are used in jewellery.
secondary_definitions: A capsule of gelatin or similar substance containing liquid for e.g. medicinal application.
A whitish speck or film on the eye.
A fish allied to the turbot ; the brill .
One of the circle of tubercles which form the bur on a deer's antler.
( figuratively ) A valuable little nugget of information; especially, an aphorism or tip that is operationally useful for decision-making.
( figuratively , euphemistic or vulgar slang ) The clitoris .
( heraldry ) Argent , in blazoning by precious stones.
( uncountable , typography , printing , dated ) The size of type between diamond and agate , standardized as 5- point .
